alert.note: Alert for Fergus County below 4500ft; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 9:10PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Fergus and southeastern Chouteau Counties through 1000 PM MDT... At 909 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Geraldine, or 21 miles north of Stanford, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Geraldine and Square Butte. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Fergus County below 4500ft; Western and Central Chouteau County
